CDC-2025-0024-5293 2025-06-19 Comment from Cole, Joanna
Support for Removing COVID-19 Vaccines From the Market Support for Disclosing Conflicts of Interest and Transparency
 None ACIP – Want to Regain the Public’s Trust? I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. As of May 30, 2025, the... 1 1:1 I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. The commenter clearly expresses a desire to remove all currently licensed COVID vaccines from the market, citing concerns about safety and the number of reported deaths. They also call for more rigorous testing standards for vaccines, indicating a need for transparency and sound research.
CDC-2025-0024-0387 2025-06-16 Comment from Sellitto, Rhea
Support for Continued Access to COVID-19 Vaccines Support for Keeping/Reinstating Previous ACIP Members (Expert Panel) Support for Disclosing Conflicts of Interest and Transparency Support for Strong Vaccine Recommendations for Vulnerable Groups ⚠️
 None To RFK Jr. and Members of the CDC ACIP committee: I have no conflicts of interest to disclose. Our community deserves the best health science can offer! Each individual should feel informed and protected for the sake of their health. We need expert advisors back on ACIP. We also deserve to know ab... 1 1:1 Everyone of all ages should protect each other by getting vaccinated and should have the ability to do so. Recommend everyone be vaccinated against COVID. The commenter expresses strong support for continued access to COVID-19 vaccines and emphasizes the need for expert advisors on the ACIP committee, indicating a desire for transparency regarding conflicts of interest. They also advocate for vaccination as a means of community protection, particularly highlighting the importance for all ages.

Support for Removing COVID-19 Vaccines From the Market Support for Disclosing Conflicts of Interest and Transparency

In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. As of May 30, 2025, the... 1 1:1 I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. The commenter clearly expresses a desire to remove all licensed COVID shots from the market, citing deaths reported following vaccination. Additionally, they advocate for rigorous research and transparency in vaccine approval processes, indicating support for disclosing conflicts of interest and ensuring vaccines undergo thorough testing.
CDC-2025-0024-6851 2025-06-20 Comment from Lantz, Jamie
Opposition to Removing COVID-19 Vaccines / Support for Continued Access Opposition to Politicizing Vaccine Policy / Support for Science-Based Recommendations Support for Keeping/Reinstating Previous ACIP Members (Expert Panel)
 None As an educator of older adults and the caregiver for my immunocompromised mother, I strongly oppose the nomination of Vicky Pebsworth, Martin Kulldorff, Retsef Levi, and Robert Malone to the CDC’s Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP). Surely you will agree that these individuals do no... 1 1:1 Appointing individuals who reject the scientific consensus on vaccines undermines the integrity of the committee’s work. The commenter expresses opposition to the nomination of individuals to the ACIP who they believe spread vaccine misinformation and lack appropriate qualifications, indicating a strong belief in the importance of science-based vaccine policies and the integrity of the ACIP. Additionally, by referencing the critical role of ACIP in shaping vaccine policy, the commenter implicitly supports continued access to COVID-19 vaccines that align with scientific consensus.
CDC-2025-0024-8025 2025-06-21 Comment from Anderson, Danielle
Opposition to Removing COVID-19 Vaccines / Support for Continued Access Support for Keeping/Reinstating Previous ACIP Members (Expert Panel) Support for Access to All Routine/Recommended Vaccines for Everyone Support for Strong Vaccine Recommendations for Vulnerable Groups
 None Docket: CDC-2025-0024 Public Comment for the June 25-27, 2025, CDC ACIP Committee Meeting To RFK Jr. and Members of the CDC ACIP committee: I have no conflicts of interest to disclose. Today, I am writing to express grave concerns about the recent termination of all 17 members of the CDC ACIP co... 1 1:1 Everyone must have regular access to updated COVID vaccines and widely available with full coverage by health insurance. The commenter expresses strong opposition to the removal of COVID-19 vaccines and emphasizes the importance of continued access to vaccines, particularly for vulnerable populations. They also highlight concerns about the termination of the previous ACIP members, noting their expertise in vaccine safety and efficacy, and the necessity of maintaining access to vaccines during outbreaks of preventable diseases.

 None ACIP – Want to Regain the Public’s Trust? I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. As of May 30, 2025, the... 1 1:1 I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. The commenter expresses a clear position for removing COVID-19 vaccines from the market due to reported deaths and a historical precedent. Additionally, they highlight the need for rigorous research and transparency in vaccine studies, indicating support for stricter ethical standards and accountability in vaccine approval processes.

Support for Continued Access to COVID-19 Vaccines Support for Access to All Routine/Recommended Vaccines for Everyone Support for Strong Vaccine Recommendations for Vulnerable Groups ⚠️
 None DC ACIP expert advisors must support widespread and unhindered access to a wide range of safe and effective vaccines, including COVID, HPV, influenza, MMR/MMRV, meningococcal, and RSV vaccines. Currently available FDA-approved vaccines are safe and effective. Children, adults, and pregnant people a... 1 1:1 We need a universal recommendation for COVID vaccination for people of all ages, including children and pregnant people, at least annually. The comment emphasizes the necessity for ongoing access to COVID-19 vaccines and endorses universal recommendations for vaccination across all demographics, including vulnerable groups such as children and pregnant individuals. It also advocates for broader vaccine access and support for routine vaccinations.

My husband had the J&J vax and within a few weeks had a stroke and in a place, we were told near the brain stem that was quite rare. The neurologist REFUSED to report it to Vaers. We were ignored after insisting ... 1 1:1 I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots and to clean up the Vaers system! The commenter expresses a clear demand for the removal of all currently licensed COVID vaccines and emphasizes the need for improvement in the VAERS reporting system, indicating concerns about vaccine safety and the integrity of vaccine approval processes. This reflects a stance that aligns with support for transparency and accountability, as well as a desire for science-based vaccine policy.

The comment explicitly calls for the removal of all licensed COVID vaccines and references significant death reports associated with them, indicating a strong opposition to the continued availability of those vaccines. Additionally, it highlights the need for rigorous studies of all vaccines, which aligns with demands for transparency and accountability in vaccine research and approval processes.

The commenter explicitly calls for the removal of all currently licensed COVID vaccines, indicating a strong opposition to their continued use. Additionally, the plea for rigorous scientific studies before licensing vaccines suggests a desire for science-based recommendations rather than politicized decisions.

 None Docket: CDC-2025-0024 Public Comment for the June 25-27, 2025, CDC ACIP Committee Meeting To RFK Jr. and Members of the CDC ACIP committee: I have no conflicts of interest to disclose. Today, I am writing to express grave concerns about the recent termination of all 17 members of the CDC ACIP co... 1 1:1 Creating such barriers is harmful to the public’s health. Everyone must have regular access to updated COVID vaccines and widely available with full coverage by health insurance. The commenter clearly expresses opposition to the removal of the previous ACIP members and emphasizes the need for continued access to COVID-19 vaccines, highlighting the importance of vaccination rates to prevent infectious disease outbreaks. Additionally, they advocate for universal access to vaccines, underpinning the essential role of vaccines in public health.

Support for Removing COVID-19 Vaccines From the Market Support for Disclosing Conflicts of Interest and Transparency
 None ACIP – Want to Regain the Public’s Trust? I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. As of May 30, 2025, the... 1 1:1 I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. The commenter explicitly urges the removal of all licensed COVID shots, referencing public health concerns and historical precedents for vaccine withdrawal. Additionally, the call for rigorous research standards implies a need for transparency and accountability in both vaccine approval and ongoing recommendations.

 None ACIP – Want to Regain the Public’s Trust? I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. Additionally, they emphasize the need for rigorous research and transparency in vaccine trials, aligning with the stance about the importance of disclosing conflicts of interest and ensuring proper study methodologies.
